div.l: A ful faire sight was it vpon hem two
On halidaies biforne hire wolde he goo
With his typett wounden aboute his heed
And sche cam after in a gite of reed
And Symkyn hadde hosen of the same
There durste no wight clepen hire but dame
Was noon so hardy þat wente by the way
That with hire dorste rage or ones play
But if he wolde be slayn of Symkyn
With panade or with knyf or with boydekyn
For Ielous folk ben ꝑperilous eủeremo
Algates thei wolde here wyfes wenden so
And eek for sche was somdel smoterliche
Sche was as digne as water in a diche
As full of hoker ⁊and of bismare
Hire þoghte þat a lady shulde hire spare
What for hire kynrede and hire nortelrie
That sche hadde lerned in the Nonnerie
A doghter hadde þei bitwixe hem twoo
Of twenty ȝere with outen eny moo
Sauyng a child þat was of half ȝere age
In cradel it lay and was a ꝓpropre page
This wenche þikke ⁊and wel I growen was
With Camois nose ⁊and eighen gray as glas
With buttokes brode and brestes rounde ⁊and hye
But right faire was hire here I wil not lye
¶ The ꝑpersoıı̄un of þe town for sche was so faire
In purpos was to make hire his haire
Bothe of his catell and of his mesuage
And straıı̄unge he made it of hire mariage
His purpos was to be stowe hire hye
Into som worthi blood of Auncetrie
For holy chirches good moot ben dispendid
On holy chirche blood þat is discended
Therfore he moste his holi blood honoure
Thogh þat he holy chirche scholde devoure
Grete soken haþ this mellere out of doute
Of whete and malte of all þe lond aboute
